intro: Anil dalzelliana, commonly known as the dwarf red hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and vibrant red flowers. The plant produces showy, five-petaled blooms that are typically 5-7 cm in diameter. Its leaves are ovate, glossy, and arranged alternately along the stem. Anil dalzelliana is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and ability to thrive in warm, humid climates.
